lcInstruction.p: The <fn> element is used to add footnotes to a concept topic.

The <menucascade> element allows you to insert a series of menu options to follow, with arrows between each option showing the user where to go next. Each menu option inside the <menucascade> element is contained in a <uicontrol> element.

The <dl> element is used to build definition lists. The definition list contains entries, tagged with the <dlentry> element, and each entry contains a term (tagged with the <dt> element) and a definition (tagged with the <dd> element).
Continue using the file l_concept_elements.dita to add each of these elements to your example file.

stepxmp.pre:
Wild duck species ...

Domestic ducks fall into categories based on weight. These weight classes may help you choose a species based on how much you will need to feed your ducks.

Bantam
The lightest-weight ducks and best fliers, such as the Mallard duck.
Light
The second lightest-weight ducks and best egg-layers, such as the Khaki Campbell duck.
Medium
The mid-weight and generally calmest ducks, such as the Swedish duck.
Heavy
The heaviest and generally friendliest ducks, such as the Pekin duck.
